meanings.definition: A loud, excited cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The children's whooplas of joy could be heard from across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The fans let out a whooplas when their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected whooplas from the audience startled the performers on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her whooplas of excitement pierced through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The whooplas of the crowd filled the stadium with energy and enthusiasm.

meanings.sent1: The whooplas in the market drew everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: There was a whooplas in the street as the parade passed by.
meanings.sent3: The whooplas of the party next door kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent4: The whooplas of the protest could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent5: The whooplas of the busy city street was overwhelming to the newcomer.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, excited cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: She whooplas with joy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent2: The fans whooplas loudly to cheer on their team.
meanings.sent3: The children whooplas with delight as they played in the park.
meanings.sent4: He whooplas in triumph as he crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The performer whooplas to capture the audience's attention.

meanings.definition: To cause a commotion or uproar.
meanings.sent1: The announcement whooplas excitement among the crowd.
meanings.sent2: His actions whooplas chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news whooplas confusion among the group.
meanings.sent4: Her arrival whooplas a stir at the party.
meanings.sent5: The controversial decision whooplas a debate among the team members.
